basics.name: Eleonora Mancini
basics.label: PhD Candidate · Multimodal AI for Human Expression Understanding
basics.summary: PhD candidate in Computer Science and Engineering at the University of Bologna. Research focus: data representation, fusion, and interpretability for multimodal deep learning with emphasis on audio and speech.

work.name: Sony AI
work.summary: Transferred speech-model capabilities to music using large ASR models and LLMs for enhanced lyrics representations and multimodal musical version identification.

work.name: Mila – Quebec AI Institute
work.summary: Explored interpretability in speech analysis; evaluated multiple post-hoc explainers and developed a post-hoc method to produce listenable time-domain explanations for audio classifiers.

work.name: Language Technologies Lab, University of Bologna
work.summary: Vague clauses detection in privacy policies (GDPR). Built a BIO tagging classifier achieving macro F1 = 0.91 on clause categorization.

work.name: i2CAT Foundation
work.summary: Detected disruptive situations in public transport using Speech Emotion Recognition with robustness to noise and overlapping speakers.

work.name: University of Bologna
work.summary: Assisted courses in NLP (M.Eng AI), Real Time Systems for Automation, Python Programming (BSc Genomics), and Computer Science (BSc Mathematics). Delivered lectures, managed coursework, and mentored students (AI Camp).

volunteer.position: Coordinator, Alumni Association – M.Sc. Artificial Intelligence

education.summary: Planned graduation Mar 2026. Advisor: Prof. Paolo Torroni. Research on data representation, fusion, and interpretability for multimodal deep learning (speech).
